specification.name: Cosmological Spaces - De Sitter and Anti-de Sitter Geometries
specification.description: Geodesic distance computations in cosmological spacetimes with non-zero cosmological constant: de Sitter (dS) space with positive curvature and Anti-de Sitter (AdS) space with negative curvature. Essential for holographic duality, quantum gravity, and cosmological applications.

overview.purpose: Provide geometric operations for cosmological spacetimes with cosmological constant Λ
key_concepts: De Sitter space: maximally symmetric spacetime with positive Λ (expanding universe)
Anti-de Sitter space: maximally symmetric spacetime with negative Λ (hyperbolic time)
Both are solutions to Einstein field equations with cosmological constant
FLRW metric: general cosmological spacetime including dS and AdS as special cases

mathematical_foundation.de_sitter_metric: ds² = -(1 - r²/L²)dt² + (1 - r²/L²)⁻¹dr² + r²dΩ² where L = √(3/Λ)

operations.name: ads_distance
operations.description: Compute geodesic distance between two points in Anti-de Sitter (AdS) space using embedding coordinates or intrinsic geometry. AdS space is a Lorentzian manifold with constant negative curvature, crucial for AdS/CFT holography.

point1.description: First point in AdS_n space (can be given in global, Poincaré, or embedding coordinates)
constraints: Must be a valid point in AdS_n manifold
Must be a valid point in AdS_n manifold

ads_radius.description: AdS radius L = √(−n(n−1)/(2Λ)) characterizing curvature scale

coordinate_system.description: Coordinate system used for input points

distance.description: Geodesic distance d(p₁, p₂) in AdS space

properties.coordinate_distance: float (distance in embedding coordinates if applicable)

complexity.explanation: Linear in dimension for computing inner products and coordinate transformations in embedding space R^{n,2}

mathematical_formula.ads_embedding: AdS_n embeds in R^{n,2} with pseudo-inner product: −X₀² − X_{n+1}² + X₁² + ... + X_n² = −L²
mathematical_formula.distance_formula_timelike: d = L·arccosh(−⟨X,Y⟩_L/L²) with imaginary part for timelike

implementation_notes: Prefer embedding coordinates for maximum symmetry and simplicity
Convert input coordinates to embedding coordinates if given in global or Poincaré
Compute Lorentzian inner product: ⟨X,Y⟩_L = −X₀Y₀ − X_{n+1}Y_{n+1} + ∑_{i=1}^{n−1} X_iY_i
Check sign of ⟨X,Y⟩_L to determine causal type: < −L² (spacelike), > −L² (timelike), = −L² (lightlike)
For spacelike geodesics: d = L·acosh(−⟨X,Y⟩_L/L²)
For timelike geodesics: d is imaginary or use proper time τ
For lightlike geodesics: d = ∞ or use affine parameter
Handle numerical precision: acosh argument must be ≥ 1
Coordinate conversions: Global ↔ Embedding uses hyperboloid parameterization
Poincaré coordinates cover only half of global AdS (Poincaré patch)
For AdS/CFT: boundary is at r → ∞ (global) or z → 0 (Poincaré)
Use stable numerics for large coordinates or near-boundary points

Reject with error; L must be positive

applications.cosmology: Model spacetimes with negative cosmological constant

operations.name: ds_distance
operations.description: Compute geodesic distance between two points in de Sitter (dS) space, a maximally symmetric spacetime with positive cosmological constant Λ. Models expanding universes and inflationary cosmology.

point1.description: First point in dS_n space (can be given in global, planar, or embedding coordinates)
constraints: Must be a valid point in dS_n manifold
Must be a valid point in dS_n manifold

ds_radius.description: de Sitter radius L = √(n(n−1)/(2Λ)) characterizing curvature scale

coordinate_system.description: Coordinate system used for input points

distance.description: Geodesic distance d(p₁, p₂) in dS space

properties.value: float (can be spacelike, timelike, or null)

properties.cosmological_horizon: bool (true if points separated by horizon)

complexity.explanation: Linear in dimension for embedding coordinate computations and inner products

mathematical_formula.ds_embedding: dS_n embeds in R^{n+1,1} (Minkowski with +−−...− signature): −X₀² + X₁² + ... + X_{n+1}² = L²

implementation_notes: Use embedding in R^{n+1,1} with mostly-minus Minkowski signature
Compute Minkowski inner product: ⟨X,Y⟩ = −X₀Y₀ + ∑_{i=1}^{n} X_iY_i
Check sign of ⟨X,Y⟩: > 0 (spacelike), < 0 (timelike), = 0 (lightlike)
For spacelike geodesics: d = L·arccos(⟨X,Y⟩/L²)
For timelike geodesics: use proper time τ = L·arccosh(−⟨X,Y⟩/L²)
Cosmological horizon at d = πL/2 (points cannot causally communicate beyond this)
Handle numerical issues: arccos argument must be in [−1, 1]
Global coordinates cover entire dS; planar coordinates cover only static patch
Planar coordinates become singular at cosmological horizon r = L
de Sitter space has constant positive scalar curvature R = n(n−1)/L²
For inflationary cosmology: dS models exponential expansion phase
Geodesic completeness: all geodesics are complete (no singularities)

test_cases.name: Distance Between Origin and Point in Static Patch
Timelike Separated Points (Same Spatial Location)
validation: Points differ only in time coordinate

edge_cases.handling: Return d = πL/2 and flag as horizon-separated; no causal connection
Reject with error; L must be positive
Project to hyperboloid or return error

edge_cases.case: Planar coordinates outside static patch (r ≥ L)
edge_cases.handling: Return error or convert to global coordinates

use_cases: Model expanding or contracting network topologies
Cosmological horizon as natural partition boundary
dS for temporal evolution with exponential growth
integration_with_hypersync.performance: Both operations O(n) linear in dimension
integration_with_hypersync.coordinate_transformations: Support global, planar (dS)/Poincaré (AdS), and embedding coordinates
